item.title: [REQ-222] Administration of site roles and permissions needs UI and performance improvements
item.description:
Currently, Sakai administration is divided between Users (for managing user accounts), Realms (for managing role-permission-user mappings in a site or template), and a set of overlapping site management tools including Site Info, Sites, and Worksite Setup (for browsing sites, creating a site, attaching roster feeds to a course site, setting up tools for a site, adding members to a site, managing ad hoc user groups, and importing content). (Course sites also have Section Info.)

Legacy user and site tools are addressed elsewhere. The administrative functions of Realms also need improvement.

1) Performance is slow when there are a large number of sites.

2) There's no direct relationship between a site's realm and the site. Instead, the site ID is buried in the realm name. There needs to be easier ways to locate the desired realm. For example, site metadata such as term, title, and created-by might be included as sortable or searchable columns in the listing.

3) There should be some direct UI link between the sort of administrative functions in the site management tools and the sort in Realms.

===

Original Description:

Improve admin tools:

* improve performance; response time is often slow when the system contains a large numbers of sites

* improve search capabilities

* improve sorting/filtering capabilities

The admin tools are often slow when the system contains large numbers of sites. It is hard to find a realm when only some part of the site name is known - site and realm tool each contain search functions that would be useful in the other or are missing useful search capabilities (search for a realm by knowing part of a site title for example, or search for sites a user has created). We need to be able to sort/filter by term in the admin in the admin tools as well.
item.summary: Administration of site roles and permissions needs UI and performance improvements

comments.comment: As originally described, this requirement touched on sites browsing, user management, and the Realms tool. The sites part seems to be duplicated in REQ-103. The users part seems to be duplicated in REQ-230. I've therefore tried to narrow this down to the Realms part. John, please check to see if I've missed anything important.
Reviewed by Worksite & Admin Tools.

item.description:
This was implemented in Sakai in r5861 (post-2.1.1). So this requirement is really just for the New Tools now; and, if we are going to use the Style Guide or something similar going forward, then it should include a description of this aspect of the paging process.


Original Description:
For the List Navigator a better description of what should happen as one pages through a list and hits a boundary is needed. The current beahvior in most circumstances is that when you are viewing 20 items at a time from a 33 item list Next will move you from viewing 1-20 to viewing 14-33. Preference has been expressed for it behaving otherwise and making the boundaries firm so you are not seeing items on multiple pages; view 1-20 and then view 21-33. No preference has been expressed yet for keeping it the way it currently works.

This requirement should apply to both paging JSF widget and the style guide definition.
item.summary: Paging description for List Navigator needs to better explain what to do at boundaries

comments.comment: The proposed solution is appropriate - it matches the design patter seen in webmail applications. This bug has a major dependancy on another unstated bug. There is currently no way to approve and make changes to the sakai style guide. it is a dead document, with no owner. It is owned by the Sakai UI DG, but there is no working group working on it. Until it is resolved who approves changes to the style guide, who makes those changes and how those changes are made (continue updating a Word document or publish more openly?), this bug can't be resolved.
Added comment to description: This requirement should apply to both paging JSF widget and the style guide definition.
UI team done with this one.

item.title: [REQ-240] Documentation: WSRP Architecture Document
item.description:
We need an architecture document that describes how WSRP is architected and how it works in Sakai.

WSRP (Web Services for Remote Portlets) is dynamic plug-ins for portal pages. WSRP defines how to plug remote web services into the pages of online portals and other user-facing applications. This allows portal or application owners to easily embed a web service from a third party into a section of a portal page (a 'portlet'). The portlet then displays interactive content and services that are dynamically updated from the provider's own servers.

The docs should be located in docs/architecture and included in the Sakai distribution. Developers would be able to reference these when working with WSRP in Sakai.
item.summary: Documentation: WSRP Architecture Document

comments.comment: Ready for vote

customfieldvalues.customfieldvalue: Essential (Can use Sakai but need this ASAP)

item.title: [REQ-243] Documentation: Need web services architecture document
item.description:
This document needs to provide an overview of how web services work - their general model and patterns and how to creat new web services and modify existing web services.
This should also have a section on web services security.

A Web service is a software system designed to support interoperable machine-to-machine interaction over a network. It has an interface described in a machine-processable format (specifically WSDL). Other systems interact with the Web service in a manner prescribed by its description using SOAP-messages, typically conveyed using HTTP with an XML serialization in conjunction with other Web-related standards.

Web services are a specific type of application built on an architecture that offers the promise of allowing any client to work with any server, anywhere in the world. Getting computers to speak with one another has been a goal of programmers ever since the second computer was built. RPCs. or Remote Procedures Calls, have been used for many years, but RPCs are mostly are "tightly-coupled," built specifically for applications on specific platforms and in specific languages. Any changes made on either end may create havoc on the other end. "Loose coupling" refers to a relaxed dependency between two applications. Web services provide a loosely-coupled way of communicating between two programs.

These documents should be located in docs/architecture to allow easy access for developers.
item.summary: Documentation: Need web services architecture document

comments.comment: Ready for voting

customfieldvalues.customfieldvalue: Essential (Can use Sakai but need this ASAP)

item.title: [REQ-255] appointment sign-up capability for Schedule tool
item.description:
Several faculty have wanted to use the Schedule tool to:
- allow students to sign up for slots during office hours
- allow students to sign up as discussion leaders for certain weeks during a seminar.

In both cases, it would be nice to have permission granularity within the Schedule tool to allow the site owner to designate certain blocks of time for which students would have "revise" capability. This way, students could modify only certain events in the schedule, rather than having global write or revise permissions in the tool.

Also it would be nice if this revise permission was in effect only for blank fields: once a student has signed up for a slot, others would not have the ability to revise that selection. Only blank fields in the designated time blocks could be "owned" by students with revise or write permission.

Finally, for the office hour option, it would be nice if students' displays of the Schedule list only their selected time slot, not every other student's slot. A lot to ask, I realize; perhaps this type of scheduling tool should be a new tool, which could then export information into the main class Schedule.
item.summary: appointment sign-up capability for Schedule tool

comments.comment: Ready for Vote.

customfieldvalues.customfieldvalue: Desirable (Can use Sakai but would like this)

item.title: [REQ-268] Need for "Melete-like" Rich Content Authoring Tool for Fully Online Courses
item.description:
Please excuse any ignorance as I'm still a bit of a "newbie" at this point in time...

Marist College is currently in a production pilot with Sakai (called iLearn at Marist) with one of our many fully online programs. From this experience, it is clear to us that having a "Melete-like" tool that allows our faculty to create "rich media" content for online delivery is critical.

My understanding is that most of the "core institutions" have historically not been heavily involved in offering fully online courses and have primarily used their CMS capabilities to supplement/enhance face-to-face courses. I feel that this has driven the requirement process towards tools and functionality that is needed in this context of use. Although there is a good deal of overlap between tools sets needed for fully online and "web-facilitated" courses, I feel that there are some difference as well. This area is one of them.

Although the capabilities of the Resource Tool is great, we need more than just a place to upload and download files. Instead, we need a tool that allows faculty to place an "instructional wrapper" around those files and digital content that is upload so that the students have a full and rich learning experience in their online courses.
item.summary: Need for "Melete-like" Rich Content Authoring Tool for Fully Online Courses

comments.comment: related to REQ-9 on structuring content for presentation

customfieldvalues.customfieldvalue: Essential (Can use Sakai but need this ASAP)

item.title: [REQ-277] K-12 Tools
item.description:
So far, I have not heard too much discussion about using Sakai at the K-12 level but we, at Marist College, believe there is great potential in this area. We have had some discussions with K-12 groups in our state and are hoping to collaborate with them on some pilot activities next school year.

In talking with these initial contacts, it has become clear that there are additional functionality needs at the K-12 level that would be important to have before Sakai could penetrate too far into this "market". One that has surfaced in our discussions is a "test and quiz" tool that was adapted for K-12 needs (e.g. allowed school wide reporting, supported connections to state standards and school district curriculum benchmarks, etc.).
item.summary: K-12 Tools

comments.comment: Assigning to Kyong-Jee for review.
Ready for voting

item.title: [REQ-281] make calendar event frequency more flexible

Currently, the Schedule tool does not allow users to add events that occur every Monday/Wednesday or Tuesday/Thursday. Additionally, you cannot set an event to happen every third Thursday of the month.

The system should allow the user to choose the frequency of an event with some flexibility.
item.summary: make calendar event frequency more flexible

comments.comment: Ready for vote.

customfieldvalues.customfieldvalue: Desirable (Can use Sakai but would like this)

item.title: [REQ-282] Users should have more information and control over site import
item.description:
The import functionality in Sakai site management tools is too opaque. The site administrator can pick a site and some tools, but there's no indication of what the effect will actually be. The import service and interface should support finer granularity. Tool-specific code should give some indication of what sort or amount of data would be imported. In some cases, such as Resources, it may make sense to give the user control over which portions of data will be copied.

Use Cases:

* An instructor creates a new course site for Chem 101 and wants to reuse material from the previous term's site. She selects "Import from Site", selects the old site, and sees that a Resources import will bring in 3 folders with 120 items, an Announcements import will bring in 0 announcements, and a Tests & Quizzes import will bring in 50 assessments.

===

Original description:

From Site Info there is an option for "Import from site." The system gives no indication that there are resources to import. Even if there is a resource to import it doesn't tell you its been added nor does it give you a choice of resources you want. It just comes back to Site Info. Need a way to tell if there is something in there to add and then notification that something was added. Confirmation similar to the add/ remove tools. 'You have added 6 items.'
item.summary: Users should have more information and control over site import

comments.comment: Carleton, the import feature of Site Info is not limited to just Resources, you can import content from other tools as well. You can also select which tools you want to import from, however, you cannot choose individual items to import . It might help if you could provide some specific, detailed use cases to better illustrate the capabilities you're asking for. It sounds like you may be after mulitple things here, which your use cases should help clarify: (1) A listing of the actual items in the various tools that are available for import (2) Selection of which items in a tool are imported, so you can skip some, if necessary (3) A confirmation of what excatly has been imported in terms of x Resources, y Announcments, z Schedule events, etc.
Since Carleton hasn't yet responded, I guessed at clarification and a use case based on Peter's comment.
Reviewed by Worksite & Admin Tools.

customfieldvalues.customfieldvalue: Desirable (Can use Sakai but would like this)

item.title: [REQ-289] Student site tab names should be based on their section names rather than the course site name
item.description:
When Sakai supports external feeds for course site sections, Sakai should identify the site to students by the name of their section rather than by the name of the site.

Use Cases:

* An instructor has created a course site "Cognitive Science Frontiers". Two externally managed rosters are feeding site membership, one for "Psych 212 LAB 01" and the other for "Phil 312 LEC 02". Both have site sections associated with them. When a student from Psych 212 logs onto Sakai, he sees a tab labeled "Psych 212 LAB 01" rather than a tab labeled "Cognitive Science Frontiers".

(I'm not sure this captures the requirement. See comments.)

===

Original description:

Sakai should allow instructors to combine rosters of two or more sites

Goals:
Instructors can combine the rosters for two or more sites
Sakai will display combined rosters as separate sections in a site
Students tab will indicate the course and section number of the site for which he or she signed up, not the site from which the instructor is delivering the combined content.
item.summary: Student site tab names should be based on their section names rather than the course site name

comments.comment: If I understand it, the only thing this description adds to REQ-104 is the requirement for students to see a site ID based on a section name rather than on the site name. I've changed the description to narrow it down. I'm not sure I understand it, though! 1) "Rosters" is ambiguous here. Do you mean that the instructor is combining two external roster feeds into one course site? Or do you mean that the instructor is combining two membership lists from two existing Sakai sites (which may be projects) into one site -- that is, treating an internal Sakai site as if it was an external feed? 2) What would happen when a student is in more than one section? They still have to see just one course site tab, right? 3) What would happen if the roster is feeding more than one site? Would the student see two tabs with the same name?
Reviewed by Worksite & Admin Tools.

customfieldvalues.customfieldvalue: Essential (Can use Sakai but need this ASAP)

item.title: [REQ-296] in year view, remove the dates from a previous month
item.description:
In the Schedule tool, in the year view, the days from a previous month appear in gray. This is nice. The issue is that the numbers for the days in the previous month also appear. This makes it seem like there is an event on that day.

We recommend that the numbers that indicate days in the previous month are removed from the year view in the calendar.

For example, a calendar grid showing the month of Feb. 2006 starts with

Jan 29
Jan 30
Jan 31
Feb 1
Feb 2
Feb 3
Feb 4

It would be nice to remove the dates for January. I've attached a screen shot to illustrate the point.
item.summary: in year view, remove the dates from a previous month

comments.comment: Sounds like the root problem here is probably confusion in the interface over which days have events; days that are not in a month are more noticably "highlighted" perhaps than days in the month with events in the default skin. Perhaps another solution here is to make sure that days with events stand-out the most visually and the days outside of a month are treated more akin to typlical greying-out; though with some carry-over visual clue for days with events that can be used in a more subdued way on days outside of a month that have events. Lots of good examples out there for inspiration in Palm datebook, Outlook, etc.
Ready for vote.

customfieldvalues.customfieldvalue: Desirable (Can use Sakai but would like this)

item.title: [REQ-297] The HTML editor used across many Sakai tools needs to be improved and must work well across the most popular/used browsers
item.description: The HTML editor that is used across many Sakai tools must be improved, offer more capabilities than it currently does, and work consistently across the most popular browsers in use today. Faculty on our campus would like to be able to cut and paste complex html code (that they have previously developed) into Sakai assignments and have them render appropriately. There is no way to tell what part of the cut and pasted code, is causing the problem, therefore an additional capability needed is some sort of html "debugger". As for being compatible with other browsers, the html editor in Sakai does not work well on Internet Explorer.
item.summary: The HTML editor used across many Sakai tools needs to be improved and must work well across the most popular/used browsers

comments.comment: Assigning to Jordi for review.
Improve the HTML editor deals with the requeriments associated.

customfieldvalues.customfieldvalue: Essential (Can use Sakai but need this ASAP)

The style guide should be applied to Worksite Setup

This was initially reported at UC Berkeley with regard to the Worksite Setup. Instructors and staff were confused about the checkboxes in Worksite Setup because they are so far away from the action buttons. If the style guide were applied, the page would have the following changes --

(1) checkboxes would move to the right side of the page in a Remove column
(2) a revise link would appear under each item (this could be changed in the style guide so clicking the item automatically brings up an editable window)
(3) the add button would remain at the top of the page.
item.summary: Apply style guide to worksite setup

comments.comment: I wonder if this should be broken down tool by tool, one requirement for each tool that needs the style guide. It would be less daunting that way.

Change langauge from apply style guide to all legacy tools to apply style guide to worksite setup since the requirement is talking about worksite setup. It is the only tool that didn't worked on during the legacy tool style guide alignment project in 2005.
UI group done with this one.

item.title: [REQ-302] The User Management Tool (In Admin Workspace) needs additional functionality
item.description:
The User Tool ( In the Admin Workspace ) needs additional functionality:

1) There needs to be summary at the top of the page that tells the Sys Admin how many users there are (like in the Sites tool)
2) There needs to be additional attributes displayed about the user:
           a) A date that the user last logged into Sakai
           b) The date that the user first logged into Sakai
           c) Roles held by the users
3) There needs to be a way to search based on the attributes above
4) There should be a way to "PURGE" users who have not logged in in XX amount of days
5) There needs to be a mechanism to get a a "broadcasted or emergency message" out to all users or sets of users ( like just the Instructors) currently on the system (when for example you need to reboot the server) or when you install new course management tools.
6) Additionally, needs to be a way to schedule "SYSTEM DOWN TIME" and have it show up on all user's schedules
item.summary: The User Management Tool (In Admin Workspace) needs additional functionality

comments.comment: Rose, it sounds like you've got several requirements mixed together here. Could you please split them out and provide as much detail as possible on what you are looking for in terms of new capabilities? Thanks.

Hi Peter, I can turn this into at least 2 maybe three requirements - do you want to give me the rights to EDIT this requirement or do you want me to enter new ones entirely. Also, will I have the ability to link these requirements? Thanks, - Rose

Rose, as a member of the requirements group you have permission to update issues, including linking; you do need to be logged in to Jira though, which you might not be, if you just followed a link in an email for instance.

Hi Peter, When I first came into look at this, I did not have the EDIT button. When I came back in tonight - I do have it - so I was able to re-work the requirement. After giving the list of things in the requirement some thought, I decided that the most important thing that Sakai wasn't giving us in this area was enough User management tools - so I reworked the requirement to focus on that area.
Just a note: As described, none of these new functions would apply to Sakai users who log in through some provider other than an internal Sakai user account
Reviewed by Worksite & Admin Tools.

item.title: [REQ-310] Site maintainers can select an option to make a file or folder visible, or not visible, to site participants.
item.description:
Use case: When copying files/folders to another site, instructors can specify whether they wish to hide (make invisible) the content from students or other site participants. Admin staff (e.g., support staff and sakai admins should be able to do this as well).

comments.comment: Could you provide some examples or use cases of this requirement?

Hi Salwa, When an instructor asks for a new site to be set up in the current CMS at Stanford (CourseWork), they have the option to ask for content from a previously taught site to be copied forward to their new site. Since some instructors store answer keys to problem sets/tests under the CourseWork-equivalent of the Resources tool, these instructors do not wish to have this type of content be visible to students in the new site until they manually release such content to them. item.title: [REQ-320] Ability to display current term courses
item.description:
Provide ability for instructors and students to view course sites by term (e.g., by Fall 2005, Winter 2006, Spring 2006, Summer 2006) in the portal when they login. They should also be able to filter the site listing so that it only shows courses from a chosen term.
Current view of courses is not user-friendly and difficult to navigate through.

Taking/Participating:

Teaching/Maintaining:

item.title: [REQ-321] Tests & Quizzes - support cross-listed classes by allowing instructor to view grades by class
item.description:
In the Tests & Quizzes tool, instructors can currently view scores on a specific assessment by section. We also need to be able to support cross-listed classes, and allowing instructors to view scores by a specific cross-listed class. Two examples of cross-listing:

1. A class is offered under two codes, one for undergraduates, one for graduates. Example: ECON 101 / 201.

2. A class is offered by different departments, e.g. ECON 101 / PoliSci 101

The instructors will need to be able to view the scores of all students who enrolled in Econ 101, then of all students in Econ 201 or PoliSci 101. Similar to View by "All Sections / Section xxx / Group"
item.summary: Tests & Quizzes - support cross-listed classes by allowing instructor to view grades by class

comments.comment: Reviewed by Assessments & Tools. This issue is ready for voting from our perspective.

This needs more fleshing out, I'm afraid. If the idea is that the current two-level membership hierarchy of "Course Site" / "Sections" needs to be turned into the three-level hierarchy "Course Site" / "Course Offerings" / "Sections", then this effects a lot more places than Samigo and Section Info. It changes Site Info, it potentially changes all of the UI in all the section aware tools, it changes enterprise integration.... If the idea is that external feeds from multiple courses should automatically create site sections which identify the course, then this is incorporated by REQ-104 and REQ-365. But the section aware tools (including Samigo) wouldn't have to change at all. In 2.1, they show a drop down list of named user groups; in this later version, they still show a drop down list of named user groups. Behind the scenes, those user groups are being named and populated differently than in 2.1, but Samigo doesn't know that. Abby, can you clarify which (if either) of these cases you had in mind?

customfieldvalues.customfieldvalue: Essential (Can use Sakai but need this ASAP)

item.title: [REQ-322] Tests & Quizzes - support audio recording
item.description:
The Tests & Quizzes tool needs to support Audio Recording as a method for "answering" a question. This is the current method used by all the language classes at Stanford University.

The current method with our CourseWork tool is that an instructor creates a question that can be text-based (that the student reads on screen), or where a video or audio clip is played. When taking the test, the student will read / listen to / watch the "question" and then click a button to begin recording their audio response. For example, a student might read a text prompt, "Say the days of the week" and then click the Record button, speak into a microphone, and speak the days of the week in the given language. The student then clicks Stop, and has the option to listen to the recorded audio, and can re-record it, before submitting it.
item.summary: Tests & Quizzes - support audio recording

comments.comment: Ready for voting.

item.title: [REQ-323] Ability to customize site ID
item.description:
Site ID should follow the format of term-department-number. For example, 1064-CHEM-101-01.

Currently, site ID follows an unintuitive format to target audience. For example, 52be78bb-2fd4-482d-8071-19ea7a86b5cd.
item.summary: Ability to customize site ID

comments.comment: Juliette, I need to clarify the requirement. Which of the following comes closest to your intent? 1) Course site creators need the ability to specify a human-friendly site ID. 2) "Sites" and other administrative tools need to show the human-friendly site title instead of just the human-hostile site ID. 3) Course site IDs should be based automatically on metadata about the course and section whose roster feeds the course site. (Note that this requires Sakai to actually know about things like "term", "department", and "course number", which is one aspect of REQ-365.)

customfieldvalues.customfieldvalue: Essential (Can use Sakai but need this ASAP)

item.title: [REQ-325] Use same WYSIWYG editor throughout both Sakai and Melete Course Builder.
item.description:
Use same WYSIWYG editor throughout both Sakai and Melete Course Builder.

The specifics of the requirement are:

Currently, Melete and Sakai use two different editors or at least two different versions of one editor. Also, Vivie Sinou at Foothill DeAnza uses yet another editor, a commercial product. The other important area for the editor is in Samigo, because some testing requires students to use the editor.
 
Our specific need is for an editor that does two things.
 
1. Allows for an easy interface for both non-technical people (i.e., faculty and students) who want a WYSIWG interface, and for coders. The current editor does this, but is not very robust.
 
2. An editor that can easily incorporate math symbols (i.e., Math ML or similar). The largest classes (and thus a big user of online learning) and the largest amount of testing on campus is done by science departments--math, chemistry, engineering, physics. They all need the capability for easy input of equations both in content creation and in testing.
item.summary: Use same WYSIWYG editor throughout both Sakai and Melete Course Builder.

comments.comment: Added a style guide component
Sent a message to Wende asking for clarification on where the inconsistencies are.
UI team complete.

comments.comment: User Story: Students need a copy of submitted/graded assignments, tests and quizzes in their own personal Resources area for use in their Portfolio. Currently, if a student wants to add a submitted assignment to their Portfolio, they must find the class and the assignment, download the assignment to their desktop and then upload it to their personal Resources area. By storing a copy in their personal Resources area upon submission, they have easy access to the assignment, test or quiz later on.

item.title: [REQ-347] Cross tool integration should be improved
item.description:
Tools should be be able to be better integrated with one another and linking between tools should be handled in a standard way by the framework.
eg:
1) gradebook/assignments,
2) resources/assignments,
3) gradebook/discussion,

To expand on this requiremnet:
There needs to be a way to link tools to each other within the sakai framework. In other words, something like "Tool A depends on Tool B version 1.5 and cannot function without it" should be specified in the tool xml file.
Also, there should be ways for Tool A to pull data from Tool B or send data to Tool B that are standardized and confidured via an XML file contained within the structure of Tool A.

Use-Case:
I have an attendance tool (AT tool) that I have written. My attendance tool works by interfacing with a system at my university which records attendance using "clickers" that students operate to indicate their presence in class. This data is stored in an external database which is part of the attendance system. The instructor accesses this database through the AT tool. The instructor can use the tool to calculate grades based on the attendance data from the external system and send a grade item and set of grades to the gradebook tool being used in his course site. The grades are calculated based on a set of rules in the AT tool. The instructor may create multiple grade items or choose to update an existing grade item.
The key is that the AT tool has to be able to get a list of grade items, or send a list of grades and a grade item definition to the gradebook tool. It also needs to be able to send a grade item ID and a set of grades and probably needs to get the updated grades.

This is obviously very complicated and this requirement only talks about it on a fairly non-technical level. The key here is some standardized way of linking tools together and defining input and output of data.
item.summary: Cross tool integration should be improved

comments.comment: I expanded on the requirement and added a use case to it. -AZ
Ready for voting

customfieldvalues.customfieldvalue: Essential (Can use Sakai but need this ASAP)

item.title: [REQ-348] Samigo Alternate Numerical Forms
item.description:
Samigo should automatically allow for alternate numerical forms in grading questions

The Assessment creation tool should allow for alternate valid representations of a numerical answer without requiring the answer to be an exact textual match. For example it would be useful to the sciences for the system to recognize that 0.00357 and 3.57E-3 are equivalent.
item.summary: Samigo Alternate Numerical Forms

comments.comment: Doesn't the short answer question type allow for multiple correct strings? Doesn't it allow the instructor to enter both 0.00357 and 3.57E-3 as correct answers?

Luke, it does, but that is a textual match. I should have bee nmore clear in my requirement description. Ideally, if something is a floating point answer there should be some way to indicate that the answer is numeric and the answer should be interpreted in any valid form. Also - when dealing with floating point numbers, it would be good to have a tolerance factor. So for example, we are looking for 0.00357 +/- .0002. This may need to be a separate requirement.

I would also like to see numerical answers treated as numbers rather than text. And, similar to Bill's observation about tolerances supplied as part of a student's answer, its also important to support tolarences supplied by the Instructor. Such tolarances are not always necessary, however, a good assessment system that handle numbers supports such instructor-defined tolerances to handle differences in assumptions about signficant figures (e.g., using 3.14 for Pi versus 3.1415927, round-off differences introduced by students at intermediate steps in a problem, or differences in precision on various calculators a student might use). In a case where an instructor is looking for a student to correctly utilize significant digits as part of their calculation, then an Instructor maybe looking for an exact match; so approaches which have a general round-off tolarance applied system-wide break-down.
Assigning this issue to Owen for review.
It might not be obvious at first, but this issue actually influences and depends upon SAMIGO's capabilities for import and export using QTI.

It's starting to look like we might to group tother some of these SAMIGO issues and consider them comprehensively from the perspective of the tool's QTI support. On the one hand, the commitment to QTI brings some default requirements. On the other hand, it will shape whether and how others are met. In this case, for instance, a known showtcoming of QTI is lack of support for precision checking, i.e., no reliable way to check for significant figures or decimal places. I think we should also link to REQ-218 for now.
It might not be obvious at first, but this issue actually influences and depends upon SAMIGO's capabilities for import and export using QTI.
Ready for voting.

customfieldvalues.customfieldvalue: Essential (Can use Sakai but need this ASAP)

While the future belongs to content standards, many of us will need support in moving courses off of legacy CMS's at our institutions. It would be good to have a similar project for WebCT integration. Rutgers is running an older version of WebCT (4.0). It would be useful to partner with other institutions running different versions of WebCT to create a tool that can handle differences across standard verrsions of WebCT.

Ideally, these tools will merge in to a common import tool that will recognize IMS packacged content, the current versions of WebCT and Blackboard, and older versions of that software as well.

Some specific suggestions from REQ-207: Allow instructors to list assignments in the assignment tool without having a certain due date. Allow instructors to list assignments in the assignments tool that will be turned in in class as paper or other off-line format. If the assignment will be turned in "off-line" allow a due date to specifed for information purposes but do not alert students when the date is passed. Currently if an assignment has not been turned in by a student by the due date, the line item turns bright red. item.title: [REQ-353] Class Session/Workflow Tool
item.description:
Class Workflow

Sakai is currently organized around tools, rather than being organized around class sessions (a.k.a. learning modules). In practice teaching and learning are organized around class sessions.

What would this look like? On setting up a class Sakai would create modules for each class session. So if a class meets every Monday and Wednesday for 15 weeks, 30 modules are generated, each associated with a date. Readings, slide shows, discussion topics, quizzes, homework, etc are then added to the module.
This approach better matches the way instructors organize classes in their syllabi, and also helps students focus on current work. Rather than having to search through multiple pages, students can see everything that they should be working on today in one place.

Functionality

Aggregated view - Give students a way to see an overview of every thing they should be working on in a given week together.

Tight synching with the Schedule - Class sessions appear on the schedule

Reorganizing modules
    * Have the option to add, remove, edit and merge sessions.
    * Create sessions that are not related to a date
    * Import sessions from other classes (dates would adjust appropriately)
    * Share well crafted sessions in a learning object repository

**This description borrowed from MIT's thinking of a tool for Stellar. A tool like this was proposed by the Sakai Tools Team back in the beginning of the project and was #1 on our prioritization list (of over 100 requests).
item.summary: Class Session/Workflow Tool

comments.comment: How does this differ from the module building tool provided by Melete? Currently, Melete allows you to organize modules in any way you wish: weekly, daily, topically. It automatically generates a table of contents page and provides navigation from one module to the next. Links to the modules can be added the schedule. However, it is not automatically synced with the schedule. Please expand on if this should be aprt of the Melete module-building tool or recreated in the core framework.

customfieldvalues.customfieldvalue: Essential (Can use Sakai but need this ASAP)

item.title: [REQ-355] Roles and permissions should be optimized for the most common use cases
item.description:
Our experience during the Sakai pilot suggests that the current design of authorization is not optimized for the most institutional common use cases (centralized mapping of roles to permissions; occasional override of permissions for individual users), but instead for a relatively rare use case (site-specific mapping of roles to permissions). This introduces administrative and data storage overhead, and contributes to relatively slow execution of a frequently performed query.

See SAK-2660 for detailed scenarios.
item.summary: Roles and permissions should be optimized for the most common use cases

item.title: [REQ-356] Database storage of web sessions should be eliminated or redesigned
item.description:
Sakai currently permanently stores volatile transient information about a user's web session in the enterprise database. This adds appreciably to the cost and response time of enterprise installations.

For details, see SAK-3794.
item.summary: Database storage of web sessions should be eliminated or redesigned

item.title: [REQ-357] Resource service should use relational database approach rather than XML strings
item.description:
The central resource service (used by such tools as Resources, OSP, Announcements, and the Drop Box) continues to use CHEF's XML-encoded approach to metadata storage. This is unmanageable over the long run in a enterprise system.

For details, see SAK-3799.
item.summary: Resource service should use relational database approach rather than XML strings

item.title: [REQ-359] Framework needs to support institutional human-readable user IDs
item.description:
There's a pressing cross-institutional need for a configurable institution-specific unique person identifier which is neither the Sakai user account name nor the programmatic UID used in authentication systems. This was discussed during Core Architecture meetings last year, and is a central aspect of course site management and roster views.

For details, see SAK-2924.
item.summary: Framework needs to support institutional human-readable user IDs

item.title: [REQ-360] Accessibility: Addition of accessibility elements to JSF widgets
item.description:
This will require 1) identification of accessibility elements that are missing in JSF (such as "onkeydown") and 2) customization of Sakai widgets.

The ability of persons with disabilities to use Sakai will be compromised if JSF widgets are not made fully accessible.
item.summary: Accessibility: Addition of accessibility elements to JSF widgets

item.title: [REQ-363] The Sakai portal should not force the use of iframes
item.description:
The Sakai portal should not force the use of iframes. There should either be a way to run Sakai without them or they should be taken out altogether.

On occasion, if input focus is carefully managed, iframes can be useful for embedding simple widget-like tools or views, or to provide independent scrolling handles for different aspects of the same data. They are not suitable for embedding complex interactive web applications. Indiscriminate use of iframes is a massive usability and accessibility problem.
item.summary: The Sakai portal should not force the use of iframes

comments.comment: Ready for voting

customfieldvalues.customfieldvalue: Desirable (Can use Sakai but would like this)

item.title: [REQ-364] Applications and services need easier access to richer institutional data
item.description:
Required LMS functionality is missing from Sakai, including but not restricted to the following:

Student data such as IDs, enrollment status, and number of credits sometimes need to be shown. Accurate data for official enrollment status and officially assigned instructors are needed for submitting final grades and for some security decisions. Course catalog information such as department, course title, and course description should be automatically available when creating a course site. Some authorization decisions might need to be made based on institutional roles (e.g., "departmental admin").

Despite its functional limitations, Sakai's legacy "provider"-based approach to enterprise integration is complex and has proven difficult for inexperienced developers to handle.

Some way to easily reach richer institutional data is needed. Services should be tailored to optimize common large-scale operations.
item.summary: Applications and services need easier access to richer institutional data

comments.comment: Ray -- Can you write this to indicate an example of the user experience in which they need this data. I think you have a lot incorporated here. I would take a stab at it, but don't think I could do it justice.

There *is* a lot incorporated here and in REQ-365. But both were added after the reviewing deadline, neither are slated for 2.2, and both are currently being worked on the Course Management WG. I don't think either should be included in the voting process. I added them basically so the Course Site Management project wouldn't come as a suprise to volunteers who wanted to start work on one of the many related requirements. The user experience may be best covered by the CM WG project site. But if you like we can copy and paste some scenarios here next week.

item.title: [REQ-365] Instructors and administrators need easier and more powerful management of site memberships and roles
item.description:
Course site user groups and roles should be able to be automatically defined and populated from institutional feeds. These feeds need to be displayed and controlled in ways that are meaningful to end users (e.g., titled sections organized by course numbers and titles). Some services or applications may need to update local data when enrollment data changes. Sakai must support easy reconciliation of manually managed site memberships and roles (e.g., new TAs, visiting scholars, or not-yet-officially-enrolled students) with externally managed memberships and roles.

Over time, both Sakai's legacy site management UI and Sakai's legacy membership services have grown complex and inefficient. The new functionality can only be supported by logically separating membership management from other aspects of site setup.
item.summary: Instructors and administrators need easier and more powerful management of site memberships and roles

comments.comment: Ray -- please add use case. Also, we don't want to include comments about technical solutions, that should come later. Remember, we are trying to keep simple and clear so people like me can vote on these!

item.title: [REQ-367] Bonus questions
item.description:
Allow instructors to specify a question as "bonus." A bonus question's weight would not be added to the total amount of score points possible although it would be added to a student's raw score. With bonus question a student could score 100% on an exam even without answering the bonus question correctly. Instructors should be able to set a question to bonus after a test run is complete (or ongoing) and recalculate scores based on the fact that the question has been turned into a bonus question. Among other use cases, bonus questions are useful when an instructor creates a question pool but realizes after the test run has started that one of his/her questions is testing knowledge that wasn't adequately disseminated in the class.

Just for clarification purposes, a bonus question is not a survey question.
item.summary: Bonus questions

item.title: [REQ-369] Gradebook - Due date on gradebook columns
item.description: A due date feature on a column would assign a 0 grade to the student if a score hasn't been submitted by the due date. This feature is particularly useful when the column is referenced by a running grade column. When calculating the running grade, after the due date, any missing scores in this column will be counted as zeros. Prior to that date, if a score is missing this column will not be used to calculate the running grade.
item.summary: Gradebook - Due date on gradebook columns

item.title: [REQ-370] Gradebook -- Running grades column
item.description: Include a running grade column in the gradebook. A running grade column is like a formula column but it is date sensitive and will exclude particular columns from a formula if the due date of the column in question has yet to pass. The running grade calculates a grade based on the columns that are currently due or those that have been turned in and scored. If an assignment is not yet due it will not be counted against the student, but will be counted if a score is present. This feature is useful so that students can extrapolate final grades even when not all of the assignments have been turned in.
item.summary: Gradebook -- Running grades column

item.title: [REQ-371] Gradebook -- Dropping scores option in a formula column.
item.description: A formula or calculated column should have options that allow the lowest score from a group of selected columns to be dropped from the formula's calculation. For example, lets say an instructor delivers five quizzes to her students over the course of the semester. She should be able to specify in the final grade calculation, that the calculation take the four highest quiz scores but drop the lowest.
item.summary: Gradebook -- Dropping scores option in a formula column.

item.title: [REQ-372] Gradebook - Formula Column
item.description:
Include a formula column that can calculate a grade based on scores in other columns.

The formula GUI should allow an instructor to type standard operators (+-*/) into the formula, use parenthesis ( ) to control what gets calculated first, and allow the instructor to type in other columns as variables into the formula.

An advanced formula column should also allow an instructor to group other columns together and specify that the lowest score from that group be dropped.

A really advanced formula column should be able to extrapolate a final grade based on the work that a student has done up until a particular point in the semester. These formula columns are sometimes called "running grade columns." A good running grade column won't include columns in a calculation if the column in question is associated with an assignment that isn't due yet.
item.summary: Gradebook - Formula Column

comments.comment: This isue created to incorporate other gradebook issues that were submitted.
Assigning to Luke for review.
Ready for voting.

item.title: [REQ-374] Resources tool should have the ability to store multiple versions of files in Sakai.
item.description:
Reporter - Charles Severance: Add Versioning Capabilities to Content Hosting, Resources Tool, and WebDav. Add the ability to store multiple versions of files in Sakai. This will require a GUI design that allows users to manage their multiple versions and possibly technical support tools as well to manage the stored versions of files. This may require modifications to existing user interfaces and the addition of wholenew user interfaces to properly support these features.

Reporter - Clay Fenlason: Document Versioning. Many of our courses involve team projects that involve several people working on the same document. This is awkward to manage without some versioning capability in the Resources tool. I would project that the same thing would be valuable for research collaboration.

Use cases:
- a collaborator uploads a new file into a location with a file already bearing that name. The new file is stored with a new version number visible through the interface.
- other collaborators are able to access previous versions of the same document
- at least one collaborator or manager has the ability to revert the document's version to a previous version.
- this versioning capability happens consistently through both WebDAV and the web interface
item.summary: Resources tool should have the ability to store multiple versions of files in Sakai.

comments.comment: Incorporates REQ-11 and REQ-112

customfieldvalues.customfieldvalue: Essential (Can use Sakai but need this ASAP)

item.title: [REQ-375] Timed Release of documents/files in Resources tool
item.description:
Faculty want finer grained control over when resources are visible to students. They want to be able to upload resources, yet constrain the dates/times at which they are available and dates/times at which they are no longer available to students. They would like to be able to manually release document(s) that are in the Resources tool but currently hidden

Use cases:
- An instructor wants to pre-load all her resources at the beginning of the term, but organized into one folder for each week of class, and each folder is automatically "turned on" at the beginning of each week.
- An instructor wants to upload exam solutions to the site, but set them to be visible only at midnight following the exam day.
- An instructor wants "stale" content to disappear from the student's view after two weeks, yet still wants to keep the content visible to teaching assistants and instructors of the site.
- An instructor wants to upload lecture notes in one go, but set them to be revealed to students only after the scheduled lecture.
- An instructor may want to post answer sets to homework assignments, but only make them available after the due date of the homework and would like to post them all at the beginning of the semester.
item.summary: Timed Release of documents/files in Resources tool

Is there a suggested or agreed approach yet to how this should be implemented? My initial thought was to use resource propteries much like Rutgers did for their resource ordering patch.

item.title: [REQ-376] viewing /using student email addresses
item.description:
Instructors want to see / expect to see student email addresses. They also expect that they will be able to send messages to students in the following ways:

(1) messages to the whole class (currently accomplished at UC Berkeleythrough Announcements)
(2) messages to select groups (currently accomplished at UC Berkeley through Assignments + Section/Group Info definitions)
(3) messages to individual students (currently not possible > the workaround is to use another system at UC Berkeley)

Might want to split this into two requirements: one for surfacing user emails in appropriate places in the interface, maybe even turning names into email hot links or hot links to their Profile with their email, and one for sending email to specific students or sites or groups thereof. (The later is sort of like Message Center, http://bugs.sakaiproject.org/confluence/display/MFT, which is currently a contrib project.)

customfieldvalues.customfieldvalue: Essential (Can use Sakai but need this ASAP)

item.title: [REQ-377] Configurable Workflow
item.description:
The ability to configure workflow in tools, which involve the handing off of items between users would be useful, such as Assessment tools like Assignments or Samigo. These tools already have some notion of this, such as their ability to had an assignment back for a student to do it over. It would be nice to make this workflow more configurable, however, inorder to support other use cases. For instance, you might just one grade (or Assignment) to reflect work on a paper where first the student submits an outline, you review it and return it, they then submit a rough draft, you review and return it, then they finally submit a paper. Maybe it goes even further and you allow multiple drafts to be submitted before you finally grade one.

Another example comes for sharing grading responsibilities on complex submissions, such as exams, where different instructors are responsible for grading specific questions; the old split up the stack of exams and pass them from office to office, which we can avoid hopefully in the electronic world of Sakai. An individual instructor would like to be able to tell which exams they've left to work on, or have already worked on. It would also be useful to know when the exams are all done; when the instructors have all completed their pieces then whomever is responsible can be notified or see an indication in interface that thing are now ready for their step, such as releasing the grades at the appropriate time.
item.summary: Configurable Workflow

comments.comment: Ready for voting.

customfieldvalues.customfieldvalue: Desirable (Can use Sakai but would like this)
Any new tool which involves handing off of the items it manages bewteen users

item.title: [REQ-378] Resources tool should allow instructor to set documents/files within and outside a folder, and folders, in a desired order
item.description:
Instructors should be able to set documents/files within and outside of folders, as well as folders in resources in whatever order they choose, rather than having documents appear in alphabetical order. An instructor may have several folders, and files outside of folders, in the Resources area -- Homework, Assignments, Images, Maps, Research Resources List. Currently, Sakai puts these items in alphabetical order.

This occasionally forces faculty to rename their resources in manipulative ways simply to have the arrangement of folders and files happen in the way they wish.

The site owner should be able to determine the order in which folders and files appear. The site owner should also be able to determine the order in which documents/files within a folder appear.

Use cases:
- An instructor sets a "default" ordering for a site's resources, which need not adhere to any sorting algorithm.
- a site user can still re-sort the items according to their preferences, but always have a quick way to restore the "default" ordering that the instructor has established.
item.summary: Resources tool should allow instructor to set documents/files within and outside a folder, and folders, in a desired order

comments.comment: Incorporates REQ-78, REQ-156,REQ-189,REQ-201,REQ-306, REQ-319
Reordering portion clumped with REQ-378, while the drag-and-drop portion separated out into REQ-388.
REQ-378 concerns allowing instructors to determine the order of resources. Adding topic hierarchies would give instructors even more options in setting the order of items in resources..

item.title: [REQ-379] Configurable Display fields for resources, including description field
item.description:
Faculty often complain that the resources tool does not display the information they most care about. They don't care about the modified date so much as the description, for example. Faculty would also like to be able to enter instructions related to the document or file, or to display copyright status of a document.

A Description field is now provided when a user uploads a document, but the description is not visible to those accessing the site. Similarly, the copyright field, which currently exists, is not visible to those accessing the site.

A solution would be to let users select "Options" to decide what columns of data would be displayed, toggling them on and off as appropriate.
item.summary: Configurable Display fields for resources, including description field

item.title: [REQ-380] Accessibility: Alternative Content Presentation for Persons with Disabilities
item.description:
Persons with disabilities should be provided with alternative renderings upon entering Sakai. Ideally, Sakai should remember their preferences, so they are presented as the default for subsequent visits. The choices, at a minimum, should include:

1. Enlarged text--100%, 200%, 300%, 400%
2. Reverse type (white on black or yellow on black)

Additional options would be to:

2. Select their own foreground (text) and background colors (replacing 2)
3. Show <alt> text instead of images
4. View without CSS
item.summary: Accessibility: Alternative Content Presentation for Persons with Disabilities

comments.comment: This update was to describe additional opportunities for improving accessibility.

customfieldvalues.customfieldvalue: Essential (Can use Sakai but need this ASAP)

item.title: [REQ-383] Hierarchical Site Navigation Built on Typologies
item.description:
The ability to type sites and expose those types to the primary navigation as a hierarchy would greatly improve the most fundamental navigational structure in Sakai. This need will become even greater as time goes on and multiple years and semesters pass. We can easily imagine a user wanting to drill down through:

Courses
  2006
    Fall
      BIO 204
   Spring
      ECON 327
   2007
Collaborations
  Committees
    Hiring Committee for Computer Engineer (2006)
    Hiring Committee for Computer Engineer (2010)
   Interest Groups
     Dogs
     Paleontology of Cambodia
   Study Groups
     Calculus 208
    
Right now Sakai's site navigation organizes sites alphabetically. While this might scale tolerably well for 10 or 15 sites, it does not scale for 30 or 40, and over the course of, say, an intstructor's career, she might have many more than that.
item.summary: Hierarchical Site Navigation Built on Typologies

customfieldvalues.customfieldvalue: Essential (Can use Sakai but need this ASAP)

item.title: [REQ-384] Dynamically targetted notification tool
item.description:
There should be a way to communicate something to a subset of all Sakai users, for example:
- Send a message about training opportunities to users who have the role of Site owner, Lecturer or Tutor in one or more course sites
- Send a message about a feature change to users who are site owners of project sites.

It should be possible to specify and combine search constraints for one or more of:
- Role (within a site type)
- Site type
- Account type
- Sites (select multiple sites)
- Course codes (i.e. provider IDs)

This requires an admin message tool which can dynamically construct a list of recipients, and then deliver a message in one or more chosen formats (e.g. IM, email, SMS, popup).

It should also be possible to save a 'recipient profile', essentially a saved query string, so that instead of reconstructing the recipient query each time, one can simply select a predefined target such as 'Course site managers', etc.

Use Cases:
* Send an email to all users informing them of an upcoming system-upgrade, the new features that will be available, and associated down-time.
* Send an email to all Instructors highlighting resources available to them for help with creating their course sites for their next semester classes.
* Send an email to all project site members announcing an increase in their Resource quotas.
* Send a message to all users with the "maintain" role in at least 1 site.
item.summary: Dynamically targetted notification tool

item.title: [REQ-396] Resources should allow user to define permissions at folder level
item.description:
Assumes that Resources is group/section aware
Goals:
Instructors can define whether a specific role/group/section has access to the items contained with a subfolder of a site
Instructors can give a specific role/group/section permission to add new items to a subfolder of a site without granting this role/group/section access to the entire site's resources

The instructor or maintainer of a worksite will have the ability to set permissions for individual folders and files within resources. For example, an instructor could restrict (hide) a folder in Resources until he is ready to make it available to students. The instructor would do:
-Resources
-Click "Folder Permissions" next to the desired sub folder
-Unclick the checkbox next to Student and under "read" (currently this is checked by default and cannot be altered when read is allowed at the site level)

The current design of requiring instructors to turn off read permissions at the site level to prevent read access to subfolders is undesirable as it is more likely that instructors will want to turn off access to individual folders & files while leaving the majority of documents as read access.

Incorporates REQ-91, REQ-188
item.summary: Resources should allow user to define permissions at folder level

item.title: [REQ-397] Instant Messaging
item.description:
Instant Messaging support in Sakai is an oft requested feature. There are a variety of uses caches, approaches and technologies suggested.

(1) Enhanced presence and chat while online: Convert the Users Present List into a Buddy List for the site; or for the system, with users in the site you are currently in differentiated somehow from users in other sites in which you are a member. Clicking on a name starts a chat with that person; or enters the default chat room for the site.

(2) Integrate with existing desktop IM clients
a. use IM as a notification channel (similar to email)
b. allow users to be invited into and join a Sakai chat from a desktop IM client
c. 'import' presence into Sakai from a desktop IM client

(3) For sites not using "user presence" build an IM tool; very similar in that case to existing chat, but supporting private conversations too.

(4) When messages are sent in Chat display some sort of notification to other site participants who are logged in.

(5) Using IM as an underlying messaging system for collaborative tools (such as whiteboard)

Technologies suggested include Jabber/XMPP, and for clients AJAX, Java or Flash.

Implementation would need to take into account privacy concerns and options, and visibility of participants outside the scope of the site.

For instance, policy may require that certain types of users or users within specific sites (such as underaged children) may not be seen or converse with other types of users (such as college students).
item.summary: Instant Messaging

comments.comment: Appears ready for voting

customfieldvalues.customfieldvalue: Essential (Can use Sakai but need this ASAP)
University of Cape Town and others incl those in Jabber/XMPP working group

item.title: [REQ-398] Resources provider
item.description:
We would a provider that allows for hybrid content hosting.
Currently, there is a provider that allows us to have both local users and external users. We would like the same functionality for Sakai resources, that will allow a hybrid of sakai database resources, and externally generated resources (even if these resources are then read-only).

We have content on other systems, that we currently generate links for and post those links as resources in sakai. We would like to automate the process by adding a provider between the dbcontenthostingservice and spring, which will allow automatically generated resources in anything that uses the resources tool.

Use Case:
Content is added to an external system. When the user looks at their resources in sakai, the resource provider goes out and checks the external system for content related to that course. The external content is then displayed for the user along with any resources located inside that Sakai site.
item.summary: Resources provider
